answers.answer: Sore toes- tingling....pain.....It could be from a number of things: hypothyroidism-low t4 or low t3, low B12 levels, low calcium, diabetes, etc. When were your last thyroid labs?Indigestion can be related to thyroid.

Is it the big toe? if so it could be gout; is it toe joint pain? there are many conditions responsable for toe pain , Raynaud's phenomenon (caused by underlying conditions ) , nerve problems, Arthritis....Do you have more symptoms?

I am 46, and having some medical problems that seem to never stop. however most of the problem has been bladder, gall bladder and now looking for ulcers . But my problem is ALL my toes feel like they have been bunched up in to small of shoes. I have no joint swelling, no redness,It just feels like there are little pins sticking my toes all day any idea on this one ?

question: What was the answer to this?  I have the same symptoms and don't know what to take.Sore Toesby kathmarie, Mar 11, 2008 11:18PMAlso, I have indigestion.  Unrelated?
title: sore toes answer?
